5 Kiahn Martinez

Position Running Back

Height 5-8

Weight 185

Class Senior

Hometown Denver, Colo.

Highschool Regis Jesuit

Prev School University of Idaho

Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

2023 First-Team NFF Colorado Chapter All-Colorado Team (Offense)

2023 Second-Team All-RMAC

2023 (R-Jr.): Played in all 11 games and made 11 starts at running back for the Pack … Led team in rushing with 796 yards and scored seven rushing touchdowns … Also caught 24 passes for 184 yards and hauled in two touchdown passes … Was second on team in touchdowns with nine … Finished third in the RMAC in rushing yards per game at 72.4 and was fourth in the league in rushing yards (796) … Recorded 144 carries on season … Gained 70 or more rushing yards in a game four times, including a career-high 125 yards rushing at Fort Lewis (9/30) … Scored a rushing touchdown in seven of 11 games … Also tallied 796 all-purpose yards, including two games with 100 or more all-purpose yards and had one kickoff return for 10 yards … Averaged 5.5 yards per carry and 90.2 all-purpose yards per game … Earned Second-Team All-RMAC honors at running back … Is one of 11 running backs in school history to record 1,000 career rushing yards as he had tallied 1,136 yards.

2022 (R-So.): Played in 11 games as a back-up running back for the Pack … Carried the ball 74 times for 340 yards and averaged 4.6 yards per carry and 30.9 yards per game … Was second on team with four rushing touchdowns … Caught seven passes for 60 yards and averaged 8.6 yards per reception … Had one touchdown reception … Finished the season with 665 all-purpose yards and averaged 60.5 all-purpose yards per game … Had a high rushing game of 85 yards on 11 carries against Fort Lewis (10/1) … Also had 58 yards on 10 carries against New Mexico Highlands (10/15) … In the Pack’s NCAA Playoff game at Mines (11/19), Martinez carried the ball 10 times for 30 yards and scored a touchdown and returned three kickoffs of 99 yards, including a season-best 41 yard return.

University of Idaho (2019-21): Attended University of Idaho from 2019-21 … Played in a total of five games over those three seasons … Did not play in any games for the Vandals during the fall 2021 season … As a redshirt freshman in 2021, rushed for seven yards on two attempts against UC Davis during the shortened spring season … Redshirted, but played in four games as a freshman in 2019 … Made his collegiate debut at Penn State on Aug. 31 … Finished season with nine carries for 43 yards … Caught one pass at Penn State for nine yards … Also returned two kicks, averaging nearly 20 yards per return.

Regis Jesuit HS: Lettered in both football and track and field at Regis Jesuit High School … Earned First-Team Class 5A All-State honors as a senior … Was a three-star prospect according to 247Sports.com … Ran for 1,110 yards as a senior, including 633 yards over final four games of regular season to help Regis Jesuit earn a State Playoff spot … Added 498 receiving yards for 1,608 all-purpose yards on the season … Scored 27 touchdowns (20 rushing, 7 receiving) … In his high school career, he rushed for 3,384 yards and scored 49 touchdowns … Also added 685 receiving yards and nine touchdown receptions.

Personal: Born March 28 ... Multimedia Journalism major.

Career Highs:

Rushes: 21 vs. Western Colorado, 9/16/23

Rushing Yards: 125 at Fort Lewis, 9/30/23

Rushing Touchdowns: 1 (11x) last at South Dakota Mines, 11/4/23

Longest Run: 80 yards at Fort Lewis, 9/30/23

Receptions: 5 at Grand Valley State, 9/9/23

Receiving Yards: 51 at Grand Valley State, 9/9/23

Receiving Touchdowns: 1 (3x) last vs. Black Hills State, 11/11/23

Longest Reception: 25 at Grand Valley State, 9/9/23

Kickoff Returns: 3 at Colorado School of Mines, 11/19/22

Kickoff Return Yards: 99 at Colorado School of Mines, 11/19/22

Longest Return: 41 yards at Colorado School of Mines, 11/19/22
